meanings.definition: To run or extend beneath something
meanings.sent1: The rabbit was underrunning the fence to escape from the garden.
meanings.sent2: The stream underrunning the bridge was crystal clear.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky mouse was underrunning the cat to steal its cheese.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was underrunning any obstacle in her path.
meanings.sent5: The roots of the tree underrunning the sidewalk caused it to crack.

meanings.definition: To pass or go under something
meanings.sent1: The adventurous explorer underrunning the ancient ruins discovered a hidden chamber.
meanings.sent2: The dog underrunning the table to retrieve the ball.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was underrunning the bird feeder to steal seeds.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were underrunning the surface, searching for a solution.
meanings.sent5: The submarine underrunning the iceberg avoided a collision.

meanings.definition: To flow or move below something
meanings.sent1: The lava underrunning the city destroyed everything in its path.
meanings.sent2: The underground river underrunning the mountain emerged as a beautiful waterfall.
meanings.sent3: The music was underrunning the noise of the crowd, creating a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were underrunning her calm facade, ready to burst out.
meanings.sent5: The current underrunning the boat was strong, making it difficult to steer.
